verses.text: The \w song|strong="H7892"\w* of \w songs|strong="H7892"\w*, which \add is\add* \w Solomon’s|strong="H8010"\w*.

Let him \w kiss|strong="H5401"\w* me with the \w kisses|strong="H5390"\w* of his \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*: for thy \w love|strong="H1730"\w* \add is\add* \w better|strong="H2896"\w* than \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*.\f + \fr 1.2 \ft thy…: Heb. thy loves\f*

Because of the \w savour|strong="H7381"\w* of thy \w good|strong="H2896"\w* \w ointments|strong="H8081"\w* thy \w name|strong="H8034"\w* \add is as\add* \w ointment|strong="H8081"\w* poured \w forth|strong="H7324"\w*, therefore do the \w virgins|strong="H5959"\w* \w love|strong="H0157"\w* thee.

\w Draw|strong="H4900"\w* me, we will \w run|strong="H7323"\w* \w after|strong="H0310"\w* thee: the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* hath \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* me into his \w chambers|strong="H2315"\w*: we will be \w glad|strong="H1523"\w* and \w rejoice|strong="H8055"\w* in thee, we will \w remember|strong="H2142"\w* thy \w love|strong="H1730"\w* more than \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*: the \w upright|strong="H4339"\w* \w love|strong="H0157"\w* thee.\f + \fr 1.4 \ft the upright…: or, they love thee uprightly\f*

I \add am\add* \w black|strong="H7838"\w*, but \w comely|strong="H5000"\w*, O ye \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, as the \w tents|strong="H0168"\w* of \w Kedar|strong="H6938"\w*, as the \w curtains|strong="H3407"\w* of \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w*.

\w Look|strong="H7200"\w* not upon me, because I \add am\add* \w black|strong="H7840"\w*, because the \w sun|strong="H8121"\w* hath \w looked|strong="H7805"\w* upon me: my \w mother’s|strong="H0517"\w* \w children|strong="H1121"\w* were \w angry|strong="H2787"\w* with me; they \w made|strong="H7760"\w* me the \w keeper|strong="H5201"\w* of the \w vineyards|strong="H3754"\w*; \add but\add* mine own \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w* have I not \w kept|strong="H5201"\w*.

\w Tell|strong="H5046"\w* me, O thou whom my \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* \w loveth|strong="H0157"\w*, where thou \w feedest|strong="H7462"\w*, \w where|strong="H0349"\w* thou makest \add thy flock\add* to \w rest|strong="H7257"\w* at \w noon|strong="H6672"\w*: \w for|strong="H4100"\w* why should I be as one that turneth \w aside|strong="H5844"\w* by the \w flocks|strong="H5739"\w* of thy \w companions|strong="H2270"\w*?\f + \fr 1.7 \ft as one…: or, as one that is veiled\f*

¶ If thou \w know|strong="H3045"\w* not, O thou \w fairest|strong="H3303"\w* among \w women|strong="H0802"\w*, go thy way \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* by the \w footsteps|strong="H6119"\w* of the \w flock|strong="H6629"\w*, and \w feed|strong="H7462"\w* thy \w kids|strong="H1429"\w* beside the \w shepherds’|strong="H7462"\w* \w tents|strong="H4908"\w*.
I have \w compared|strong="H1819"\w* thee, O my \w love|strong="H7474"\w*, to a company of \w horses|strong="H5484"\w* in \w Pharaoh’s|strong="H6547"\w* \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w*.
Thy \w cheeks|strong="H3895"\w* are \w comely|strong="H4998"\w* with \w rows|strong="H8447"\w* \add of jewels\add*, thy \w neck|strong="H6677"\w* with \w chains|strong="H2737"\w* \add of gold\add*.
We will \w make|strong="H6213"\w* thee \w borders|strong="H8447"\w* of \w gold|strong="H2091"\w* with \w studs|strong="H5351"\w* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*.
¶ While the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \add sitteth\add* at his \w table|strong="H4524"\w*, my \w spikenard|strong="H5373"\w* sendeth \w forth|strong="H5414"\w* the \w smell|strong="H7381"\w* thereof.

A \w bundle|strong="H6872"\w* of \w myrrh|strong="H4753"\w* \add is\add* my \w wellbeloved|strong="H1730"\w* unto me; he shall \w lie|strong="H3885"\w* all night betwixt my \w breasts|strong="H7699"\w*.

My \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w* \add is\add* unto me \add as\add* a \w cluster|strong="H0811"\w* of \w camphire|strong="H3724"\w* in the \w vineyards|strong="H3754"\w* of \w En-gedi|strong="H5872"\w*.\f + \fr 1.14 \ft camphire: or, cypress\f*

Behold, thou \add art\add* \w fair|strong="H3303"\w*, my \w love|strong="H7474"\w*; behold, thou \add art\add* \w fair|strong="H3303"\w*; thou \add hast\add* \w doves’|strong="H3123"\w* \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*.\f + \fr 1.15 \ft my love: or, my companion\f*
Behold, thou \add art\add* \w fair|strong="H3303"\w*, my \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w*, yea, \w pleasant|strong="H5273"\w*: also our \w bed|strong="H6210"\w* \add is\add* \w green|strong="H7488"\w*.

The \w beams|strong="H6982"\w* of our \w house|strong="H1004"\w* \add are\add* \w cedar|strong="H0730"\w*, \add and\add* our \w rafters|strong="H7351"\w* of \w fir|strong="H1266"\w*.\f + \fr 1.17 \ft rafters: or, galleries\f*
